Articles.Content:
Although it's not technically an E3 event, Nintendo have started their 'World Championships' thingy, and the announcer said we'd see 'some games we haven't seen before'.

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/J9H8VcU21j4?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

I watched a stream on it, the DOOM reveal got me.

People never talk about games like that on this forum.
Fallout 3 exceeded almost all of my expectations. Being able to jetpack around a town you designed, in a suit of power armour you designed, firing a gun you designed sounds extremely impressive.

Fallout 4 is life. Which is good because I won't have one.

- - - Updated - - -

Fallout 4 is life. Which is good because I won't have one. N

Dishonored 2 will scratch my stealth itch like no game since Dishonored.

I am more excited for that than anything. PLUS EMILY AND CORVO ARE BACK!

Fallout 4 and Dishonoured 2 look pretty decent.

Doom 4 looks ok-ish, but I would have preferred a return to the hordes of enemies gameplay I remember from the first two games.

> 
> Fallout 4 and Dishonoured 2 look pretty decent.
> Doom 4 looks ok-ish, but I would have preferred a return to the hordes of enemies gameplay I remember from the first two games.

I think they did, just with different enemies.

Trackmania Turbo looks amazing. I started playing Trackmania back in 2006 when Nations ESWC was released and been addicted to the series ever since - looks like this one is another must-buy.

Trailer:

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/3piye62BYf4?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

> 
> I think they did, just with different enemies.

Not from what I saw, there was generally 1-3 enemies on screen at any given time. It's hard to judge from a promotional video though, the finished product could be very different.

> 
> Fallout 4 and Dishonoured 2 look pretty decent.
> Doom 4 looks ok-ish, but I would have preferred a return to the hordes of enemies gameplay I remember from the first two games.

I don't ever remember doom having hordes, then again I was more into quake than doom.

> 
> I don't ever remember doom having hordes, then again I was more into quake than doom.

Oh it did.
